subject: Communication
title: The Johari Window: Blind Spots
description: Learn The Johari Window: Blind Spots in one minute.

hook.text: You have traits everyone sees but you don't. You have traits nobody sees. The Johari Window maps these hidden zones.

buildup.text: Four quadrants: Open (known to you and others), Blind (known to others, not you), Hidden (known to you, not others).

discovery.text: Self-awareness means shrinking the Blind quadrant â€” seeing yourself as others see you, not just as you imagine yourself.

twist.text: Research shows 95% of people think they're self-aware, but only 10-15% actually are. The gap is enormous.

climax.text: Feedback from trusted others is the primary way to reduce blind spots. Self-reflection alone isn't enough.

punchline.text: You can't fix what you can't see. And you can't see it alone.

quiz.question: What percentage of people are genuinely self-aware, according to research?
